abstract: Workers at the Honda Lock factory were offered an increase of about $44 a month, less than half what they were seeking.
snippet: Workers at the Honda Lock factory were offered an increase of about $44 a month, less than half what they were seeking.
lead_paragraph: ZHONGSHAN, China — Wage negotiations between workers and managers at a Honda auto parts factory here ended on Friday night with the company’s final offer of a pay increase that was substantially less than employees had been seeking, a worker involved in the discussions said.

headline.main: Honda Strikers in China Offered Less Than Demanded
headline.print_headline: Honda Strikers in China Offered Less Than Demanded
